channel.title: [Pimpscape]Weird Player Synchronization?
channel.description:
Does anyone know how to fix the glitch (in Pimpscape) where it looks like people are walking through objects and appear to be attacking nothing until an appearence update for your client is called upon, then they appear to be where they actually are?
This is extremely hard to explain, but people with Pimpscape or people who have played Pimpscape probably know what im talking about.

item.title: [Pimpscape]Weird Player Synchronization?
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

Ok, im sorry to say but i can’t find it 90 something pages of tuts to go through, what a hassle. well my advice to you is get a new source and to have pking everywhere like pimpscape do this

public void checkwildy()
{
if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672))
{
inwildy = true;
}
else
{
inwildy = true;
}
}
public void checkwildy2()
{
if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3514))
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
else
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
}

replace your two checkwildy() voids in your new source with that. also take a look at public boolean nonWild in pimpscape and copy it onto your new server source (overwrite it) so it would be updated, but like pimpscape get me? lol

Read full topic

item.title: [Pimpscape]Weird Player Synchronization?
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

yes that what im talking about, what sgt yoshi said. the player that you see is walking through walls, appearing like he is noclipping. but your seeing it wrong. the person who is walking through walls sees himself right next to you ( the actual place) while you see him 5 spaces off. and like sgt yoshi and fr33sc4p3 said you have to make them log out OR kick them OR use a bow at them, like attack them with the bow OR find the Tut. i’ll look for you.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pimpscape]Weird Player Synchronization?
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

slay blad3:

Kick people because my client never acknowledged the fact that they died?

The client did acknowledge that they died. is that OTHER players see it differently. its something in the coding for pimpscape. There is a tut on how to fix it, because it used to happen to me, but then it stopped. you can kick the people it would be easier. if you put disconnected = true; it would get annoying disconnecting everytime you die, and especially in pk servers, because you get major ownage =/.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pimpscape]Weird Player Synchronization?
item.dc:creator: @sgt_yoshi sgt yoshi
item.description:
@sgt_yoshi wrote:

Search

Oh dear, you died! (or something along the lines of that) in client.java

Add disconnected = true; under it.

Every time you die, it will disconnect you, and when you reconnect, you will be in the right place.

  • I know fr33 said this, but I told you where to put it.

EDIT: [code]

		//pEmote = 15;
		//pWalk = 13;
		sendMessage("Oh dear you died!");
		hitDiff = 0;
                         updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
                                  disconnected = true;                                       
	}

[/code]

Try that. (code keeps looking weird once I enter it. :rolleyes: But it should be right.

the code must be lined up, it wont line up when I insert it. :eek: lol

Read full topic

like freescape said have them disconnect after, disconnect = true; but it’s really annoying to be disconnected everytime you’ve died. for the custom tele’s theres a tut by Azn or by televator() that fixes that. and theres a tut for the log out glitch which i think can fix that problem, i don’t know, its worth a try.

though the problem is with the server, server side.

while the player thats walking through walls glitched sees himself in the rightful place. you see him walking through walls, you can kick the person and that would fix it, as well.

item.title: [Pimpscape]Weird Player Synchronization?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Search for oh dear you died in your client.java.

I havnt had this before so i dont really get what you mean but what i posted i thought might of helped, if not you could add

disconnected = true; it will disconnect people when people die but they should rejoin.
Will solve that problem.

Read full topic

I do beleive both of those will work, but is there no easier solution?

Could I put it under public boolean process without uber lagging my server?
because if thats under process wouldnt the boolean correct the error every 500ms?
